Issues.Title: Run events and lifecycles hooks in per-component zones
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package

@angular/core

### Description

`OnPush` is a necessity in any large app, but it is error-prone to markForCheck on every subscription, await, setTimeout, etc. A common case is HttpClient requests.

### Describe the solution you'd like

Each component should have its own forked Zone for running hooks and event handlers. Then, Angular can automatically markForCheck() on the proper component.

If this happened, OnPush would virtually always work, improving many apps performance with minimal development.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

I don't know any easy way to add this after. A custom decorators could take care of part, but there isn't DI that would allow me to get a ChangeDetectorRef.

I'm not aware of any injectable today that I could hook and get this to work. Plus per-component injection scope is verbose. (#18015)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Run events and lifecycles hooks in per-component zones" (#27885)

Issues.Title: i18n: change default language from english
Issues.Body:
# üöÄi18n: Add possibility to specify default language different from english ### Relevant Package angular v.7 ### Description By now if you want to add i18n, you must use english as a default language ‚Äì use it in all templates and set as base language in `.xlf` files for translate. Related question: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/53947461/ng2-i18n-use-not-english-as-a-default-language-in-templates ### Describe the solution you'd like I'd like to have possibility to set default language by myself. Because sometimes app is multi language but there is no english in language list. Or you want to use another language in templates. It is very useful when you need to add i18n _after_ the project is released for default language. I suggest to use something like in `angular.json`: ``` "configurations": { "fr": { "defaultLanguage": "true", ... } ``` ### Current workaround By now I have found a workaround: never build app with default language and for _really default language_ specify translations the same with source. For example if my default language is french and second language is spanish: ```

Bonjour

``` `angular.json` ``` "configurations": { "fr": { "i18nFile": "app/assets/i18n/messages.fr.xlf", "i18nLocale": "fr" }, "es": { "i18nFile": "app/assets/i18n/messages.es.xlf", "i18nLocale": "es" } } ``` messages.fr.xlf ``` .... Bonjour Bonjour ``` messages.es.xlf ``` .... Bonjour Hola ```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "i18n: change default language from english" (#27883)

Issues.Title: feat: add an api to disable not fully supported servicer worker browser
Issues.Body:
In some Android browsers, service worker may cause white page. So add an api to disable it.

feat #27878

## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?
add an api to forbid loading servicer worker for some special browsers which can avoid white page
<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [x] Feature

- [ ] CI related changes

## What is the current behavior?
<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->

Issue Number: 27878


## What is the new behavior?
```ts
ServiceWorkerModule.register('ngsw-worker.js', {
      enabled: true,
      unSupportedAgent:['mqqbrowser']
    })
```
use 'unSupportedAgent' to disable service worker in some not fully supported browsers.

# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: --> This feature request is for @angular/service-worker


### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Some Chinese Browsers don't fully support servicer worker. Wechat browser, for example, behaves badly. It causes white page which is very horrible! So, add an api to forbid loading servicer worker for some special browsers which can avoid white page.


### Describe the solution you'd like
```ts
ServiceWorkerModule.register('ngsw-worker.js', {
      enabled: false,
      notSupportedAgent:['mqqbrowser']
    }),
```


### Describe alternatives you've considered
I want to use some service worker, but some browsers don't fully support service worker which may cause some unexpected behaviors. In this situation, forbid loading service worker in some browsers. [angular.io](https://angular.io/) also likes this in android wechat browser.

Issues.Title: Non-inline styles not working: probably to do with Ivy Renderer
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue might be caused by: the Ivy Renderer... ### Is this a regression? Nope. ### Description When using an Angular CLI generated project with the Ivy Renderer, ShadowDom encapsulation and with scss stylesheets enabled, the project does not respond to alterations in the scss. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Generate a new project using the following command in the Konsole application within an Ubuntu VM (using VirtualBox): `ng new OvalPlay --prefix op --routing --style scss --view-encapsulation ShadowDom --experimental-ivy` Add the following to the `app.component.html`: ```

A Polygon of Virtue

Throughout history polygons have been oppressed and taught that their number of sides was their only benefit to society. Snakes and smaller mammals were thought exempt. Yet it was so that the tyranny of the militant lines, whether straight, or where by nature or form they took on a prismatic curvature when viewed, has brought about terror on a scale never before anticipated. This is a site about the tyranny of lines that anyone can edit, except when I say they can't, which is when views expressed contradict views I hold concerning polygons. This site is not affiliated with either Polygon or their parent company Salon.com, nor is it involved in the arms deals with Iran and Saudi Arabia both Polygon and Salon.com participate willingly and knowingly in. Rather, it is a site concerned simply with angles of a base polygonal form, and nothing else.

``` And the following to the app.component.scss: `.op-main-content { border: 3px dashed green; background-color: blue; }` You will notice the div with the tag op-main-content does not take on these horrific shades, as I wanted it to. Instead you will need to add the following to the HTML: `style="border: 3px dashed green; background-color: blue;"` Nothing further should be required. ## üî• Exception or Error ## üåç Your Environment Angular CLI: 7.1.4 **Anything else relevant?**

Issues.Title: Document that `whenStable` requires `await` within the test function
Issues.Body:
# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report

### Description

`whenStable` returns a promise.  If the test does not perform an `await` on the promise, any failure may be missed or propagate during `afterAll`.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

It is difficult to reproduce this reliably because of the async nature.

### What's the affected URL?

https://angular.io/guide/testing#more-async-tests

### Reproduction Steps

Any test with a failure inside the `whenStable` block.

### Expected vs Actual Behavior

Success of the test instead of failure, especially when there are additional tests run after.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Document that `whenStable` requires `await` within the test function" (#27863)

Issues.Title: refactor(ivy): avoid `transitiveScopesFor` function duplication in TestBed
Issues.Body:
TestBed used to have its own implementation of the `transitiveScopesFor` function, customized for TestBed needs (to compile NgModules). This change unifies the `transitiveScopesFor` function usage by importing it from the `jit/module.ts` script and adding extra argument to configure its behavior (how to compile NgModule), so that TestBed can leverage it.

Corresponding ticket: FW-902.

- [x] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)

Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [x] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features) > not relevant
- [x] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features) (not relevant here) > not relevant


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [x] Feature


## What is the current behavior?
No assistance/validation in editor for service worker config.

Issue Number: Fixes #19847 

With angular/angular-cli#13325, it will also fix angular/angular-cli#13324

## What is the new behavior?
Assistance/validation in editor for service worker config.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?
- [X] No

## Other information

The schema follows `@angular/service-worker` interfaces ([here](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/packages/service-worker/config/src/in.ts)).

Descriptions come from the official documentation on angular.io ([here](https://angular.io/guide/service-worker-config)).

Default values have been verified in `@angular/service-worker` code ([here](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/f8096d499324cf0961f092944bbaedd05364eea1/packages/service-worker/config/src/generator.ts)).

I don't understand how the build works. When following the contributing guidelines, I can't see the static files that should be copied (like `safety-worker.js` and `schema.json`) in `dist` builds. **So this part have to be checked.**

As this is just an helper for development, this could be added in a patch version.

@gkalpak

Issues.Title: @angular/elements creating is 7-10 times slower than native custom elements
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/elements ### Is this a regression? dunno ### Description Creating custom elements via @angular/elements is extremely slow. Simple test with ~600 components shows 7-10x slowdown related to native custom element. @angular/elements with NgZone, prod mode 180ms creation + 220ms of raf hell ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1944061/50519599-cb2f6d80-0acc-11e9-95a5-68bab76206fd.png) @angular/elements without NgZone, prod mode 180ms creation + short raf mini-hell ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1944061/50519530-725fd500-0acc-11e9-860e-172f2cecbb7d.png) native custom element 20ms creation ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1944061/50519553-80adf100-0acc-11e9-9df0-50e2640ecdcb.png) ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction @angular/elements without NgZone https://stackblitz.com/edit/content-assemble-angular-elements?file=app%2Fhello.component.ts for NgZone enabling comment out `{ ngZone: 'noop' }` in `main.ts` native custom elements https://stackblitz.com/edit/content-assemble-custom-elements?file=app%2Fhello.component.ts ## üî• Exception or Error ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

7.1.4
**Anything else relevant?** It's not a synthetic case, we have a real case with thousands of lessons slides that are created in separate cms as html markup with a lot of components/exercises (usually 500-2k components nodes per slide). Currently we are using old aio approach with manual createComponent calls on appropriate nodes and its faster than using @angular/elements (https://stackblitz.com/edit/content-assemble-html-v2?file=app%2Fapp.component.ts 80ms for same example).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "@angular/elements creating is 7-10 times slower than native custom elements" (#27858)

Issues.Body:

-->
node: 
````
v10.5.0
````

````
6.1.0
````
Angular:
````
Angular CLI: 6.0.8
Node: 10.5.0
OS: win32 x64
Angular:
...

Package                      Version
------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect    0.6.8
@angular-devkit/core         0.6.8
@angular-devkit/schematics   0.6.8
@schematics/angular          0.6.8
@schematics/update           0.6.8
rxjs                         6.2.1
typescript                   2.7.2
````

### Repro steps
<!--
Simple steps to reproduce this bug.
Please include: commands run (incl args), packages added, related code changes.
A link to a sample repo would help too.
-->
1. create an Angular project
2. create a file which has a namespace with a const valueÔºö
src/app/const.ts
````
export namespace Const {
    export const Value = 'a';
}
````
3. create a lazy module, use the const value
src/app/a/a.module.ts
````
import { NgModule } from '@angular/core';
import { RouterModule } from '@angular/router';
import { Const } from '../const';

@NgModule({
  imports: [
    RouterModule.forChild([
      // BUG 
      { path: `${Const.Value}b` },
    ]),
  ]
})
export class AModule {
}
````
src/app/app.module.ts
````
import { BrowserModule } from '@angular/platform-browser';
import { NgModule } from '@angular/core';

import { AppComponent } from './app.component';
import { RouterModule } from '@angular/router';

@NgModule({
  declarations: [
    AppComponent
  ],
  imports: [
    BrowserModule,
    RouterModule.forRoot([
      {
        path: 'a',
        loadChildren: './a/a.module#AModule'
      },
    ]),
  ],
  providers: [],
  bootstrap: [AppComponent]
})
export class AppModule { }
````
4. run `ng build --prod`

### The log given by the failure
<!-- Normally this include a stack trace and some more information. -->

The output js file of AModule has wrong path value.
dist/<project_name>/0.fc3e9f73dd253ec7a2f8.js
````
(window.webpackJsonp=window.webpackJsonp||[]).push([[0],{KImX:function(n,t,a){"use strict";a.r(t);var c=a("CcnG"),o=function(){},r=a("pMnS"),u=a("ZYCi");a.d(t,"AModuleNgFactory",function(){return i});var i=c.Fa(o,[],function(n){return c.Na([c.Oa(512,c.j,c.V,[[8,[r.a]],[3,c.j],c.u]),c.Oa(1073742336,u.l,u.l,[[2,u.r],[2,u.k]]),c.Oa(1073742336,o,o,[]),c.Oa(1024,u.i,function(){return[[{path:"[object Object]b"}]]},[])])})}}]);
````
expect `{path:"ab"}` but result is `{path:"[object Object]b"}` 

### Desired functionality
<!--
What would like to see implemented?
What is the usecase?
-->


### Mention any other details that might be useful
<!-- Please include a link to the repo if this is related to an OSS project. -->
1. without "--prod" flag is correct
2. without namespace is correct
3. ` ${Const.Value}b ` and `Const.Value + 'b' ` are same

This is re-predicable using the ngc compiler directly.

//cc @fdragoon

1. I had an existing project with two apps on it.
2. ng generate library etpMenu

BUILD ERROR
../etp-menu/src/projects/bookingtome.ts(5,15): error TS2307: Cannot find module './lib/etp-menu.service'.

/*

 */

export * from './lib/etp-menu.service';
export * from './lib/etp-menu.component';
export * from './lib/etp-menu.module';

/*

export * from './../lib/etp-menu.service';

export * from './../lib/etp-menu.module';

Thanks.
Andres

Issues.Title: ng g service - provideIn configuration
Issues.Body:
### Bug Report or Feature Request (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ ] bug report -> please search issues before submitting
- [x ] feature request
```

### Command (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [x ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Versions
7.1.4


### Repro steps
When user trying to generate a service with `ng g service my-service`, by default it puts `provideIn: 'root'` option without any options


### Desired functionality
Add option for service schematic that will allot users to generate a service without `provideIn` option or specify the target.


### Mention any other details that might be useful
I'd like to suggest 2 possible solutions:
1. Allow user to specify provider target (string), default value should be 'root'. User could specify a module symbol or empty string (will not add option to Injectable decorator).
2. Allow user to disable `provideIn` option during generation with bool option.

If you find this feature useful, I'll be happy to prepare a PR for it ;)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ng g service - provideIn configuration" (#13335)

Issues.Title: Emulated view encapsulation invalidly compiles CSS custom properties in media queries
Issues.Body:
<!--
IF YOU DON'T FILL OUT THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION YOUR ISSUE MIGHT BE CLOSED WITHOUT INVESTIGATING
-->
### Bug Report or Feature Request (mark with an `x`)
```
- [x] bug report -> please search issues before submitting
- [ ] feature request
```

### Command (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [x] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Versions
<!--
Output from: `node --version`, `npm --version` and `ng --version`.
  Windows (7/8/10). Linux (incl. distribution). macOS (El Capitan? Sierra? High Sierra?)
-->
node 9.4.0
npm 5.6.0
ng cli 7.1.3

### Repro steps
<!--
Simple steps to reproduce this bug.
Please include: commands run (incl args), packages added, related code changes.
A link to a sample repo would help too.
-->

Create a new component with scss or css styles (either one will repro the bug). In the styles, define a custom property scoped under a media query:
```css
@media (max-width: 768px) {
  --kazaam: 'blue';
}
```

### Desired functionality

CSS custom properties should be compiled as-is and not suffixed, however they get compiled like this:
```css
@media (max-width: 768px) {
  --kazaam[_ngcontent-c2]: 'blue'[_ngcontent-c2];
}
```
CSS custom properties should be left unsuffixed, because it is invalid syntax.

### Mention any other details that might be useful

A workaround is to nest them in a class, though they shouldn't need to be nested. 

The same issue occurs for custom properties supplied under `:root` (:root gets prefixed) though it could be argued those should be defined in the global stylesheet. Custom properties defined under `:host` or a class are compiled properly.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Emulated view encapsulation invalidly compiles CSS custom properties in media queries" (#13333)

Issues.Title: Add flag for OnPush ChangeDetection
Issues.Body:
### Need to add flag for OnPush ChangeDetection and add it in angular.json

This is a Feature Request. My idea is to add a flag while creating a new angular project.
The flag should make OnPush changeDetection as the default.

ForExample:
ng new new-project --changeDetection=OnPush

Issues.Title: Allow Port to be null in angular.json
Issues.Body:
<!--
IF YOU DON'T FILL OUT THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION YOUR ISSUE MIGHT BE CLOSED WITHOUT INVESTIGATING
-->
### Bug Report or Feature Request (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ ] bug report -> please search issues before submitting
- [x] feature request
```

### Command (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [x] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```


### Desired functionality

The scenario I am talking about is this:

ng serve --host local-address

and omitting the port completly

i have edited my hosts file for definition of google.dev

Where local-address is on a private network and not accessibly directly from the web. In the above instance, you only need to add host to ng serve and the port is taken care internally by hosts file & nginx.

In this scenario, running the following

ng serve --host google.dev --disable-host-check

will load the page with default port which is not required and can be omitted as it is taken care internally by nginx.

### Mention any other details that might be useful

i have google.dev pointing to localhost in hosts file
`127.0.0.1   google.dev`

and in my nginx i do proxy pass
```
server {
    listen 80;
    server_name google.dev;
    location / {
        proxy_set_header   Host      $http_host;
        proxy_pass         http://127.0.0.1:4200;
        proxy_http_version 1.1;
        proxy_set_header Upgrade $http_upgrade;
        proxy_set_header Connection "upgrade";
	proxy_connect_timeout       300;
	proxy_send_timeout          300;
	proxy_read_timeout          300;
	send_timeout                300;
    }
}

```

so this can be fixed if the port allowed null in angular.json

```
"projects": {
    "my-cool-project": {
        ... rest of project config omitted
        "architect": {
            "serve": {
                "options": {
                   "host": "google.dev"
                    "port": null // allowing null would load the url without port
                }
            }
        }
    }
}


```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Allow Port to be null in angular.json" (#13326)

Issues.Title: Installing/updating TypeScript 3.2 with CLI 7.2 is a breaking change
Issues.Body:
### Bug Report
```
- [x] bug report
```

### Command
```
- [x] new
```

### Versions
CLI v7.2.0-rc.0

### Repro steps
`ng new demoapp`

### The log given by the failure
Install TS 3.2, due to angular/angular-cli#13226

### Desired functionality
Should continue to install TS 3.1.

### Mention any other details that might be useful
Angular 7.0 and 7.1 supported TypeScript 3.1 only. Angular 7.2 now supports TypeScript 3.1 and TypeScript 3.2.

But **installing TypeScript 3.2 directly is a breaking change**, as it means a higher TypeScript version is required for the whole project.

Why? Because Angular 7.2 may support TS 3.2, but any real-world app will also rely on third-party libraries that may not be compatible with TS 3.2 yet, or even that can't be compatible with TS 3.2 (example: [one my lib is affected by a regression in TS 3.2](https://github.com/cyrilletuzi/angular-async-local-storage/issues/64)).

This is why Angular will only requires TS 3.2 (or newer) in the next *major* version, but still supports TS 3.1 in minor versions.

This is also confirmed by the CLI code itself which says [here](https://github.com/alan-agius4/angular-cli/blob/9ec504eb5d0b7559389c53ada4fa0bbbbfa3061b/packages/schematics/angular/utility/latest-versions.ts#L10):
```ts
// These versions should be kept up to date with latest Angular peer dependencies.
```

But Angular 7.2 `peerDependencies` is not TypeScript `~3.2.2`, it's `>=3.1.1 <3.3` (see [here](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/packages/compiler-cli/package.json#L27)).

So the CLI may use the latest supported TS 3.2 internally, but should not install the latest one in the project.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Installing/updating TypeScript 3.2 with CLI 7.2 is a breaking change" (#13323)

Issues.Title: ngsw-config.json has no schema, so no validation and no assistance
Issues.Body:
### Feature Request
```
- [x] feature request
```

### Commands
```
- [x] generate service-worker
- [x] add @angular/pwa
```

### Versions
All CLI versions.

### Repro steps
```ng g service-worker```
or
```ng add @angular/pwa```

### The log given by the failure
There is no JSON schema for the `ngsw-config.json`, so no validation and no assistance.

This is especially inconvenient as a wrong config will often build with no errors, but then the service worker won't work.

### Desired functionality
Validation and assistance for `ngsw-config.json`.

### Mention any other details that might be useful
PR done in #13325
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ngsw-config.json has no schema, so no validation and no assistance" (#13324)

Issues.Title: Angular CLI @7 Library Build path references
Issues.Body:
<!--
IF YOU DON'T FILL OUT THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION YOUR ISSUE MIGHT BE CLOSED WITHOUT INVESTIGATING
-->
### Bug Report or Feature Request (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ x] bug report -> please search issues before submitting
- [ ] feature request
```

### Command (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ ] new
- [x ] build
- [ x] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Versions
ng: 7.1.4
Node: 10.13.0
OS: Win 10 x64 

### Repro steps
1. Scaffold a new Angular CLI project with the @7 generator.
2. Generate a new Library using the subgenerator: **ng g library libraryname --prefix=xx**
3. Add a Typings file (**index.d.ts**) under the lib folder of the library
4. Add a global namespace declaration into the Typings file
5. Add a path reference to this Typings file 
6. Run the build command for the project: **ng build libraryname**
7. Open the dist folder and then the subfolder with the name of the library.
8. The index.d.ts Typings file will appear within the lib folder, but under the esm5 and esm2015 folders, the public_api.js files contain references to the Typings file which the path is invalid, as these are within a sub folder.

Alternativley, you can add the Typings file right next to the public_api.ts file and add the references, and the paths will still be incorrect.


### The log given by the failure
No Error on build, but on serve I recieve:
ERROR ReferenceError: atlas is not defined.

### Desired functionality
Although this is a Global Namespace inside the typings file, and the Intellisense on VS Code picks it up without having to add any new references in the main application for testing, upon serving the project to test the library, the project is not able to find the namespace.


### Mention any other details that might be useful
You can clone and run [this project](https://github.com/xavidram/AtlasTypingsIssue.git) to see the error.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Angular CLI @7 Library Build path references" (#13318)

Issues.Body:

#### What is the current behavior?

to a DomPortalHost like this :

this.host = new DomPortalHost(

      this.componentFactoryResolver,

Issues.Title: fix(datepicker): native date adapter not preserving time when cloning
Issues.Body: When the `NativeDateAdapter` clones a date, it creates the clone only from the year, month and day which means that the clone's time will be different from the source.

Issues.Title: fix(tabs): pagination not working correctly on chrome in rtl mode
Issues.Body:
In #13223 we added some code that resets the scroll position of the tab header, in order to fix a bug on IE and Edge. The changes seem to have introduced an issue on newer Chrome versions in RTL mode where the transform gets negated and the header content doesn't move. These changes scope the fix only to IE and Edge.

Fixes #14689.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(tabs): pagination not working correctly on chrome in rtl mode" (#14690)

Issues.Title: Strange border on the first and last <mat-expansion-panel> children of <mat-accordion> when using the Chrome browser
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
Identical look and feel across all major/known/usual browsers.

#### What is the current behavior?
Currently when using the **Chrome** browser I get strange looking `<mat-expansion-panel>` borders, more specifically on a `<mat-accordion>`'s first and last `<mat-expansion-panel>` elements during their **collapsed** state.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
The issue can be observed at https://material.angular.io/components/expansion/examples on the **collapsed** `<mat-expansion-panel>` elements when using the latest version of Chrome (71.0.3578.98 (Official Build) (64-bit)).
https://www.screencast.com/t/HWwmpIfA6ksg


#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
The issue seems to be related to "@angular/material" 7.2.0 as it can be observed in the official documentation pages. I've only been able to detect this issue using Chrome (71.0.3578.98 (Official Build) (64-bit) on my PC. On the mobile Chrome browser the issue is not manifesting.
The issue is **NOT** manifesting on IE 11.472.17134.0 (update versions 11.0.101), Microsoft Edge 42.17134.1.0 and Firefox 64.0 (64-bit).

#### Is there anything else we should know?
It seems like the **box-shadow** of the first and last `<mat-expansion-panel>` elements is somehow shifted towards the bottom-right corner as it is too thick on the bottom and right side of those `<mat-expansion-panel>` elements and it is not present almost at all on the left side.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Strange border on the first and last <mat-expansion-panel> children of <mat-accordion> when using the Chrome browser" (#14686)

Issues.Title: fix(moment-adapter): incorrectly deserializing moment dates and not setting locale on deserialized values
Issues.Body:
Fixes a couple of issues I noticed while doing the Luxon adapter:
* If a `Moment` instance was passed in to `deserialize`, we were returning a new `Moment` instance set to the current date/time, rather than the ones from the passed-in object.
* In some cases the object returned by `deserialize` didn't have its locale set to the one from the adapter.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(moment-adapter): incorrectly deserializing moment dates and not setting locale on deserialized values" (#14685)

Issues.Title: MatTable + MatSort example not working properly: Table retrieving data through HTTP
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?

Default ordering when loading screen works.

#### What is the current behavior?

Default sort order is not applied.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
1. Go to examples https://v6.material.angular.io/components/table/examples
2. Search for: `Table retrieving data through HTTP`
3. Wrong result (I'll explain below)

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?

Angular Documentation 6.4.7 and 7.2.0, the other versions maybe

#### Is there anything else we should know?

The default sort order when loading screen is not being applied: `matSortActive="created" matSortDirection="asc"`

**Reason:** `MatSort` becomes initialized only in hook `ngAfterViewInit`, but its information is being used before `ngAfterViewInit` due to `startWith({})`.

Adding a
```ts
console.log(`requestUrl: ${requestUrl}`);`
```
in `getRepoIssues` you can see that the request made is with `sort = undefined` and `order is empty`. Look: `requestUrl: https://api.github.com/search/issues?q=repo:angular/material2&sort=undefined&order=&page=1`

**Solution I propose:** remove `startWith({})` and observe whether `MatSort` is initialized by replacing `merge(this.sort.sortChange, this.paginator.page)` with `merge(this.sort.initialized, this.sort.sortChange, this.paginator.page)`.

`startWith({})` is no longer necessary because the startup of `MatSort` will already trigger the request.

I made a fork from the example quoted above and applied the changes I described here. Follow: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-shhprk?file=app/table-http-example.ts
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "MatTable + MatSort example not working properly: Table retrieving data through HTTP" (#14683)

Issues.Title: No examples of pre-built website templates using Material for Angular
Issues.Body:
#### Please describe the feature you would like to request.
Adding examples of pre-built full website templates built with Material for Angular would be a great help for companies (especially startups and small companies) to get started with the project. For example a blog site, portfolio, simple website for a small business, etc.  

#### What is the use-case or motivation for this proposal?

- I'm a developer with little knowledge on website designing. When learning about Angular and trying to build a quick website, i could not find many examples. The main [Angular Material website](https://material.angular.io/) does not have any such examples.

- Most examples were more about "apps" and little focus on websites being built with Material. 

- We cannot build website quickly on Angular with Material without these examples. We have to build the site on Material then translate (into components) that design to Angular project. Developers need to spend a lot of time on this.

#### Is there anything else we should know?
1.  Material site has a tutorial of a full website but again we need to translate (as components) that into angular project - https://codelabs.developers.google.com/codelabs/mdc-102-web/#0
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "No examples of pre-built website templates using Material for Angular" (#14680)

Issues.Title: Label is moved very close to the hint/description text
Issues.Body:
#### What is the current behavior?
In the case of the `legacy` and `standard` style the label is moved very close to the hint/description text of the fields right above it. So there is no clear visual communication of their purpose, something that increases the cognitive load. 
![hint label](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/690575/50536824-2874fe80-0b61-11e9-98ed-8197d72f761f.png)

#### What is the expected behavior?
This could be improved if we add some space after each field
![hint label-fix-1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/690575/50536836-46dafa00-0b61-11e9-83b6-eb93bb5c9dff.png)
![hint label-fix-2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/690575/50536739-28c0ca00-0b60-11e9-9d28-980ae579a19f.png)
![hint label-fix-3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/690575/50536740-2bbbba80-0b60-11e9-8a9d-9a86675673a9.png)

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
Visit this app and enter a name and a city. Then check how close the hint text is to the label and the button
- https://stackblitz.com/edit/ngx-formly-ui-material-label-issue


#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Angular 7.x
Material 7.x

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Label is moved very close to the hint/description text" (#14671)

Issues.Title: Make mat-autocomplete scroll behavior match mat-select.
Issues.Body:
#### Please describe the feature you would like to request.

Disable the ability to scroll the page when the autocomplete options are displayed, so autocomplete works the same as mat-select.

#### What is the use-case or motivation for this proposal?

Currently when you use mat-autocomplete, the options do not stick to the dropdown field - reported in #12500. The mat-select behavior works great, so could we copy it for mat-autocomplete?

#### Is there anything else we should know?

Looking through the mat-select code, there's 1000 lines of code related to scrolling. I could work on a PR with some pointers to where the behavior is located.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Make mat-autocomplete scroll behavior match mat-select." (#14669)
